str2: Happy, blessed, to be envied. A prolonged form of the poetical makar; supremely blest; by extension, fortunate, well off.
That, that one there, yonder. From ekei; that one (neuter) thing); often intensified by the article prefixed.
(a) (as adj.) enslaved, (b) (as noun) a (male) slave. From deo; a slave.

parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Accusative Masculine Plural

str2: The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Lord, master, sir; the Lord. From kuros; supreme in authority, i.e. controller; by implication, Master.

parse: Verb - Future Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: A prolonged form of a primary heuro, which heureo is used for it in all the tenses except the present and imperfect to find.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Accusative Masculine Plural
str2: (a) I am awake (in the night), watch, (b) I am watchful, on the alert, vigilant. From egeiro; to keep awake, i.e. Watch.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular

str2: Of Hebrew origin; properly, firm, i.e. trustworthy; adverbially, surely.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular
str2: (a) I say, speak; I mean, mention, tell, (b) I call, name, especially in the pass., (c) I tell, command.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative 2nd Person Plural
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.

word: he will dress himself to serve
parse: Verb - Future Indicative Middle - 3rd Person Singular
str2: From peri and zonnumi; to gird all around, i.e. to fasten on one's belt.

word: will have them recline at the table,
parse: Verb - Future Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To lay upon, lean against, lay down, make to recline; pass: I lie back, recline. From ana and klino; to lean back.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: From para and erchomai; to come near or aside, i.e. To approach, go by, perish or neglect, avert.

parse: Verb - Future Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: From diakonos; to be an attendant, i.e. Wait upon (figuratively) teacher; technically, to act as a Christian deacon.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative Masculine 3rd Person Plural
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
